title.narrative: 003 EFFECTIVE PRIMARY EDUCATION INSTRUCT

description.narrative: 'By 2020, education staff are capacitated and accountable for delivering curriculum reform and a continuous assessment system in primary schools, which contributes to Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, equitable access created and quality education and training provided to all learners at pre-primary and primary level and girls' access to secondary education increased, with a focus on the most disadvantaged and vulnerable children, populations and localities

participating-org.narrative: B GUMUZ REGIONAL EDUCATION BUREAU REB

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 'By 2020, education staff are capacitated and accountable for delivering curriculum reform and a continuous assessment system inprimary schools

description.narrative: UNICEF supported the establishment of a classroom-based assessment system in Ethiopia through the Assessment for Learning (AfL) Programme. The AfL was integrated into the in-service and pre-service Colleges of Education Curricula and its impact evaluation shows improvements in learning outcomes in Mathematics at primary school level. UNICEF supported the Ministry of Education and partners to conduct a comprehensive General Education Curriculum review process which laid the foundation for a new curriculum focusing on skills development for over 26 million children enrolled in pre-primary, primary and secondary schools. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:24/08/2020

actual.value: 2020:Data not availableThe Education Section has prepared a Budget brief which makes an analysis of expenditure and highlights that most of the national budget is currently allocated to higher education. The budget brief recommends the need for budget breakd
